master_plan:
# Master Test Strategy: Saucedemo.com E-Commerce Application

This document outlines the master test strategy for the Saucedemo.com e-commerce application. It serves as a blueprint for the entire engineering team, guiding test automation and execution efforts.

## 1. 🔍 RISK ASSESSMENT & PLANNING

*   **Domain Analysis:** Saucedemo.com is an e-commerce platform. The core business functions revolve around product browsing, adding items to the cart, and completing the checkout process.
*   **Risk Profile:** Failure in critical areas like authentication, product catalog, shopping cart, and checkout can lead to:
    *   **Financial Loss:** Inability to process orders results in lost revenue.
    *   **Reputational Damage:** Poor user experience due to bugs can erode customer trust.
    *   **Operational Inefficiency:** Support costs increase when users encounter issues.
*   **Testing Scope:**
    *   **In Scope:** All functionalities related to user authentication, product catalog browsing, shopping cart management, checkout process, and order confirmation. Specifically, the user goal provided will be a key test case.
    *   **Out of Scope:** Third-party integrations (payment gateways, shipping providers) will be tested at a high level but are primarily the responsibility of those vendors. Performance testing and load testing are out of scope for this initial regression strategy.

## 2. 🏗️ TESTING STRATEGY (The "How")

This strategy focuses on both Smoke and Regression testing to ensure comprehensive coverage.

*   **Smoke Suite (Sanity):**
    *   **Purpose:** To quickly verify the core functionality of the application after each build.
    *   **Test Cases:**
        *   Successful User Login with valid credentials ('standard_user'/'secret\_sauce').
        *   Product Catalog Page Loads Successfully.
        *   Add one item to cart.
        *   Navigate to the checkout page.
    *   **Execution Frequency:** After every build deployment.
    *   **Pass/Fail Criteria:** If any smoke test fails, the build is rejected.

*   **Regression Suite (Deep Dive):**
    *   **Purpose:** To ensure that new changes haven't introduced regressions in existing functionality.
    *   **Test Cases:**
        *   **Based on User Goal:**
            *   Login with 'standard\_user'/'secret\_sauce'.
            *   Sort products Z-A.
            *   Add 'Test.allTheThings() T-Shirt' to cart.
            *   Go to item details 'Sauce Labs Onesie'.
            *   Go back to product listing.
            *   Add 'Sauce Labs Bike Light' to cart.
            *   Go to Cart.
            *   Checkout.
            *   Enter info 'Jane' 'Doe' '12345'.
            *   Finish checkout.
            *   Back Home.
            *   Logout.
        *   **Negative Testing:**
            *   Invalid Login attempts (incorrect username/password).
            *   Checkout with missing required fields.
            *   Attempt to add more items to the cart than available in stock.
        *   **Edge Cases:**
            *   Concurrency: Multiple users adding the same item to the cart simultaneously.
            *   Network failures during checkout (simulate network drops).
            *   Empty cart scenarios.
        *   **Security:**
            *   Basic input validation to prevent XSS attacks (e.g., try to enter `<script>` tags in input fields).
            *   Check for SQL injection vulnerabilities (e.g., try to enter SQL commands in input fields).
    *   **Execution Frequency:** After each build deployment and before major releases.

*   **Data Strategy:**
    *   **Test Data:** A combination of static and dynamically generated data will be used.
        *   **Static Data:** User credentials ('standard\_user'/'secret\_sauce'), product names, and other fixed values will be stored in configuration files.
        *   **Dynamic Data:** User information (first name, last name, zip code) will be dynamically generated using libraries or APIs to ensure uniqueness and avoid conflicts.

## 3. 🏛️ ARCHITECTURE GUIDANCE (For the Test Architect)

*   **Framework Recommendation:**
    *   **Page Object Model (POM):** Implement a POM structure to improve test maintainability and reduce code duplication. Each page of the application should have a corresponding page object that encapsulates the elements and actions on that page.
*   **Resilience Strategy:**
    *   **Flakiness Handling:**
        *   **Polling Assertions:** Use polling assertions (e.g., wait for an element to be visible) to handle asynchronous operations and avoid false failures due to timing issues.
        *   **Self-Healing:** Implement self-healing mechanisms to automatically recover from common errors, such as stale element references.
    *   **Retry Mechanism:** Implement a retry mechanism for failed tests, especially for those that are prone to flakiness.

## 4. ⚔️ EXECUTION & MINING INSTRUCTIONS (For the Senior QA)

*   **Mining Targets:**
    *   **Prioritize the User Goal flow:** Login -> Sort -> Add Items -> View Details -> Back -> Add Item -> Cart -> Checkout -> Info -> Finish -> Home -> Logout.
    *   **Authentication Page:** Focus on login and logout functionality.
    *   **Product Catalog Page:** Explore product listing, sorting, and filtering options.
    *   **Product Details Page:** Verify product information and "Add to Cart" functionality.
    *   **Shopping Cart Page:** Test adding, removing, and updating items in the cart.
    *   **Checkout Page:** Focus on entering shipping information and completing the order.
*   **Verification Criteria:**
    *   **Successful Login:** HTTP 200 status code AND "Products" text visible on the page.
    *   **Product Added to Cart:** HTTP 200 status code AND Cart icon displays the correct number of items.
    *   **Checkout Success:** HTTP 200 status code AND "Thank you for your order!" text visible on the page.
    *   **Logout Success:** HTTP 200 status code AND Login page is displayed.
    *   **General:** Verify that all UI elements are displayed correctly and that there are no JavaScript errors in the console.

This Master Test Strategy provides a solid foundation for testing the Saucedemo.com e-commerce application. It will be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure it remains aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
